title: Dessert Recipes to Satisfy Your Sweet Tooth This Summer
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
You’ve been working hard to get into beachbody shape, and now that summer’s in full swing, it’s time to satisfy your sweet tooth with these to-die-for desserts. Check out the following recipes featuring Chino Valley Ranchers liquid egg whites.

1.Lemon Pavlova with Toasted Almonds & Coconut

For the meringue, you’ll need four Chino Valley Ranchers egg whites at room temperature, one cup granulated sugar, ½ teaspoon vanilla extract, and one teaspoon white vinegar. You have the option of buying the lemon curd and whipped cream, or preparing it yourself from scratch. For the toppings, you’ll need ½ cup almonds and ¼ cup sweetened and shredded coconut.

View the full recipe here.

2. White Cake

If you’re not a big chocolate fan, then try out this heavenly white cake. For the cake, you’ll need 2 ¾ cup of cake flour, one tablespoon of baking powder, ¾ teaspoon salt, one cup buttermilk, two tablespoons of vanilla extract, one cup unsalted butter, 1 ¾ cups granulated sugar, and five large Chino Valley Ranchers egg whites at room temperature. The vanilla buttercream frosting calls for unsalted butter, powdered sugar, heavy whipping cream, vanilla extract, and salt.

View the full recipe here.

3. Classic Angel Food Cake

Why buy angel food cake at the store if you can have it homemade? Here’s the mouth watering ingredient list: whipped cream, berries, coconut flakes, cream of tartar, vanilla bean paste, warm water, Chino Valley Ranchers egg whites at room temperature, cake flour, salt, and granulated sugar. Tempted? Check out the full recipe link below!

View the full recipe here.

4. Peanut Butter Clouds

These peanut butter meringues are salty-sweet and light. All you need are three Chino Valley Ranchers egg whites at room temperature, ⅛ teaspoon cream of tartar, ⅔ cup sugar, ⅓ cup smooth peanut butter, and three tablespoons of finely chopped salted peanuts.

View the full recipe here.

5. Flourless Chocolate Cookies

These gluten-free chocolate cookies are sure to be a hit with everyone at your next backyard BBQ or birthday party. For the recipe, you’ll need 1 ½ cup powdered sugar, ⅓ cup unsweetened cocoa powder, a pinch of salt, one or two large egg whites at room temperature, one teaspoon vanilla extract, and ½ cup semi-sweet chocolate chips.
